text:
The court-appointed Legal Commissioner U. Sagayam to probe the mining scam in Madurai informed the Madras High Court that the loss incurred by the exchequer is more than Rs 1.11 lakh crore. Commissioner’s counsel M. Radhakrishnan made the submission on the PIL moved by ‘Traffic’ K.R. Ramaswamy which came up for hearing before Chief Justice S.K Kaul and Justice Pushpa Sathyanarayana.

The State government submitted that it has circulated a letter to persons from various departments inviting them to respond to the report and sought three weeks time file a reply to the report. The Commissioner also stated that some skeleton staff is required to complete the process of winding up the commission and sought four weeks time.
title: ‘Govt. lost over Rs. 1 lakh crore in mining scam’
